summaries.body: Pope Francis is facing an uproar after he called people in a Chilean city “dumb” for protesting against a bishop accused of complicity in clerical sexual abuse.
Gannett, the owner of USA Today, said it agreed to buy Journal Media Group, owner of The Milwaukee Journal Sentinel and 14 other dailies, for about $280 million.
A California jury found Matthew Keys, a former deputy social media editor at Reuters, guilty of three felonies in relation to a 2010 incident of online vandalism.

posts.footer: The New York Times and The Associated Press

display_asset.caption: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia celebrated his 63rd birthday by teaming with N.H.L. legends to play hockey against Russian tycoons and officials. Putin scored seven goals as his team won, 15-10.
display_asset.credit: Produced by By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

sectionFrontImages.credit: Pool photo by Alexey Nikolsky - Ria Novosti / Kremlin

display_asset.title: Putin’s Hockey Party for His Birthday

summaries.body: Vladimir Putin celebrated his 63rd birthday with another show of physical prowess. The Russian leader led a hockey team to a 15-10 victory, scoring seven goals himself.

display_asset.caption: Roll call in the Bronx. Recent incidents of police officers facing denials of service have generated attention on social media.

summaries.body: Recent incidents of police officers facing denials of service at chain restaurants have generated attention on social media.

display_asset.caption: Agriculture Secretary Tom Vilsack during testimony on Wednesday before the House Committee on Agriculture.

summaries.body: A House hearing on dietary guidelines highlighted worries over the influence of special interest groups, environmental concerns and private sector bias.
“Man in Polyester Suit,” a photograph by Robert Mapplethorpe that was once denounced in Congress as obscene, sold at auction for $478,000.

display_asset.caption: The ESPN analyst Jessica Mendoza during the College World Series in Omaha in June.

summaries.body: Jessica Mendoza's groundbreaking moment as the first woman to call a major-league baseball postseason game ended up showing how sexism persists in sports.

display_asset.caption: Any merger of the brewing giants Anheuser-Busch InBev and SABMiller would be closely scrutinized by regulators.

summaries.body: SABMiller rejected an increased bid from Anheuser-Busch, saying the $104 billion offer still undervalued the company.
Should Americans eat more fat? The secretaries of agriculture and health testified before a House committee on proposed, contentious new U.S. dietary guidelines.

An Associated Press investigation revealed that the authorities working with the F.B.I. had foiled several plots by gangs thought to have Russian ties as they tried to sell radioactive material to Middle Eastern extremists.
LinkedIn agreed to pay $13 million to settle a lawsuit that accused the social network of sending too many emails to potential connections without members' consent.

display_asset.caption: The Astoria dog run will be built on the footprint of a public basketball court under the Robert F. Kennedy Bridge, between 23rd and 24th Streets.
display_asset.credit: Sam Hodgson for The New York Times

summaries.body: Dog owners in Astoria, Queens, were excited by plans to convert a public basketball court into a dog run, but they were stunned by the estimated price tag: $1 million.

display_asset.credit: St. Louis Post-Dispatch, via Associated Press

summaries.body: There should be enough pumpkins for Halloween this year, but that might not be the case for the canned pumpkin used in pies come Thanksgiving, crop experts said.

display_asset.caption: The U.A.W. president Dennis Williams, center, and Fiat Chrysler’s chief, Sergio Marchionne, right. The union set a strike deadline of 11:59 p.m. Wednesday.

summaries.body: The United Automobile Workers union has set a Wednesday-night deadline for Fiat Chrysler Automobiles to agree to a new contract or risk a nationwide strike.

posts.footer: The Associated Press, via The Columbus Dispatch

summaries.body: An 11-year-old boy fatally shot his 12-year-old brother during a target-shooting outing in Ohio, officials said.

display_asset.caption: Spencer Young makes a blended drink at Peet's Coffee in San Francisco. The chain said it was buying Stumptown Coffee Roasters.
display_asset.credit: Jason Henry for The New York Times

summaries.body: Peet’s Coffee & Tea announced that is buying Stumptown Coffee Roasters, the high-end specialty coffee company that has developed a cult following.

display_asset.caption: Clockwise, from top left, former brokers Darrell P. Read, Danny M. Wilkinson and Colin J. Goodman, all formerly of ICAP; Terry J. Farr and James A. Gilmour, formerly of RP Martin; and Noel Cryan, formerly of Tullett Prebon.
display_asset.credit: Matt Dunham/Associated Press, Neil Hall/Reuters, Lefteris Pitarakis/Associated Press, Neil Hall/Reuters, Toby Melville/Reuters and Neil Hall/Reuters

summaries.body: Six former brokers were “willing and enthusiastic” in helping a former trader at UBS and Citigroup manipulate the Libor interest rate, prosecutors said as a criminal trial opened.

display_asset.caption: Workers late Monday moved a Ten Commandments monument from the grounds of the Oklahoma Capitol in Oklahoma City.

summaries.body: Facing a court-ordered deadline, Oklahoma took down a Ten Commandments monument late at night, bringing years of debate to a quiet end.

display_asset.caption: The “Bratayley” siblings, including Caleb, left, at an event in Australia in September.

summaries.body: The death of Caleb Logan Bratayley, the 13-year-old star from the popular YouTube episodes "Bratayley, ” prompted an outpouring of grief from his fans.
Juan Martin Garcia, a Houston man who was convicted of a 1998 killing, was executed. An earlier version of this post misstated where Mr. Garcia was executed. It was Huntsville, Tex., not Houston.

posts.footer: Michael V. Hayden, the former head of the National Security Agency, on whether Edward J. Snowden would ever return to the United States, via The Guardian.

summaries.body: If you’re asking me my opinion, he’s going to die in Moscow. He’s not coming home.
Britain has been consumed for three years by a sprawling pedophile ring investigation, but there are growing doubts about the credibility of a major witness.
Shaving in space: An archivist has released thousands of never-before-seen images from NASA’s Apollo missions.

display_asset.caption: Microsoft introduced the Lumia 950 and 950 XL phones on Tuesday.

summaries.body: Not long ago, Microsoft had little interest in being in the hardware business. But on Tuesday it introduced a laptop, a tablet computer, smartphones and a wearable fitness band.

display_asset.caption: Chamath Palihapitiya, the founder of Social Capital, wrote an op-ed article in the Information on venture capital's lack of diversity.
display_asset.credit: Peter DaSilva for The New York Times

summaries.body: Nearly two-thirds of the top 71 Silicon Valley investment funds have no women in their senior investment teams, says a new study.

display_asset.caption: “I think she legit changed people’s perspective a bit,” Rihanna said of Rachel Dolezal.

summaries.body: After Rihanna defended Rachel Dolezal, the white woman who has claimed to be black, some of her fans felt that the musician crossed a line.

display_asset.caption: Plastic bags in London. Last year, about 7.6 billion single-use plastic bags were handed out by major supermarkets.

summaries.body: This week’s introduction of a 5 pence charge for plastic shopping bags in England did not lead to a nationwide mutiny, as some had warned. But it did prove polarizing.
Recently discovered materials presented in Moscow shed new light on the creation of “Swan Lake" and Tchaikovsky’s sometimes rocky beginnings as a ballet composer.

display_asset.caption: Donald J. Trump tossed campaign caps to the crowd aboard the battleship Iowa in the Port of Los Angeles last month.
display_asset.credit: Max Whittaker for The New York Times

summaries.body: Donald J. Trump rejected the notion that he has plans to abandon his presidential bid, vowing that he intends to win. Polls showed his lead in the Republican field narrowing.
